quest_title: 30ml of 0.2N NaOH solution is completely neutralised by 60ml of HCl. The normality of HCl is
explanation_txt:
Amount of HCl required to neutralise 30 ml of 0.2N NaOH = 30 ml of 0.2N HCl = 60 ml of 0.1N NaOH

\(\therefore\) Normality of HCl is 0.1N.
question_plain_title: 30ml of 0.2N NaOH solution is completely neutralised by 60ml of HCl. The normality of HCl is
explanation_plain_text:

Normality of HCl is 0.1N.

quest_title: The value of k for which the vectors \(a=i-j\) and \(b=-2\, i+k\, j\) are collinear is
explanation_txt:
Since \(a\) and \(b\) are collinear, we have \(a=mb\) for some scalar m.

\[\Rightarrow i-j=m{\rm \; }(-2i+kj)\Rightarrow i-j=-2mi+kmj\]

\[\Rightarrow -2m=1,\, km=-1\]

\({\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu}\) \(m=-\cfrac{1}{2} ,\) So \(k=2\).

quest_title: If \( |\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} | = 3 \) and \( |\vec{a} \times \vec{b} | = 4 \), then angle between \( \vec{a} \) and \( \vec{b} \) is:
explanation_txt:
\( | \mathbf { a } \cdot \mathbf { b } | = a b \cos \theta = 3 \dots (i) \)

And,

\( | \mathbf { a } \times \mathbf { b } | = a b \sin \theta = 4 \dots (ii) \)

Dividing (ii) by (i),

\( \tan \theta = \cfrac { 4 } { 3 } \Rightarrow \cos \theta = \cfrac { 3 } { 5 } \Rightarrow \theta = \cos ^ { - 1 } \cfrac { 3 } { 5 } \)

quest_title: Two blocks of masses m\({}_{1}\) = 2kg and m\({}_{2}\) = 8kg are connected by a spring of force constant 1000N/m. If the blocks are caused to oscillate then the frequency of motion will be
explanation_txt:
Reduced mass \((\mu)=\cfrac{m_{1} m_{2}}{m_{1}+m_{2}}=\cfrac{2 \times 8}{2+8}\)

\(\qquad = 1.6 \, kg\)

\(\mathrm{k}=1000 \cfrac{\mathrm{N}}{\mathrm{m}}=1000 \mathrm{N} / \mathrm{m}\)
\(\mathrm{f}=\cfrac{1}{2 \pi} \sqrt{\cfrac{k}{\mu}}=\cfrac{1}{2 \pi} \sqrt{\cfrac{1000}{1.6}}\)

ans3_plain_text: 25/

quest_title: The temperature of a patient is 104\({}^{0}\) F, his temperature on celcius scale will be
explanation_txt:
\(\begin{array}{l}{\mathrm{F}=104^{\circ} \mathrm{F} \quad \mathrm{C}=?} \\ {\cfrac{C}{100}=\cfrac{F-32}{180}}\end{array}\)

\(\begin{aligned} C &=\cfrac{9}{5}(104-32) \\ &=40^{\circ} \mathrm{C} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: A vessel has 6g of oxygen of pressure P and temperature 400K. A small hole is made on it so that oxygen leaks out. The mass of oxygen leaks out if final pressure is P/2 and temperature is 300k is
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{P_{2} V}{P_{1} V}=\cfrac{m_{2} r T_{2}}{m_{1} r T_{1}}\)

\(\begin{array}{l}{\text { or, } \cfrac{P}{2 P}=\cfrac{m_{2} \times 300}{6 \times 400}} \\ {\therefore \mathrm{m}_{2}=4 \mathrm{g}} \\ {\text { Escape }=6-4=2 \mathrm{g}}\end{array}\)

\(\cfrac{\mathrm{Q}}{\mathrm{t}}=\cfrac{K A d \theta}{d l}=\cfrac{m}{t} \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{w}} \Delta \theta\)
Or, \(\mathrm{k}=\cfrac{1 \times 10^{-3} \times 4200 \times 4}{2 \times 10^{-4} \times 210}=400 \mathrm{wm}^{-1} \mathrm{k}^{-1}\)

quest_title: Electron are accelerated from rest through a p.d. of 3600 volt and travel in a narrow beam through a field free space before entering a uniform magnetic field of 2 \(\times\) 10\({}^{-3}\) T, the flux lines of which are perpendicular to the beam which describe a circular arc of radius 0.1 m. Specific charge of electron is
explanation_txt:
\(\begin{array}{ll}{V=3600 \text { volt }} & {B=2 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{T}} \\ {r=0.1 \mathrm{m}} & {e / m=?} \\ {B e v=\cfrac{m v^{2}}{r}} & {e / m=\cfrac{v}{B r} \ldots \ldots \ldots \text { (1) }}\end{array}\)
Again, \(\quad \mathrm{P.E.}=\mathrm{K.E.}\)
\(\begin{array}{l}{e V=\cfrac{1}{2} m v^{2}} \\ {v=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 e V}{m}} \ldots \ldots \ldots . \text { ( 2) }}\end{array}\)
Then, \(\quad e / m=\cfrac{\sqrt{2 \cfrac{e}{m} V}}{B r}\)
question_plain_title: Electron are accelerated from rest through a p.d. of 3600 volt and travel in a narrow beam through a field free space before entering a uniform magnetic field of 2 10 T, the flux lines of which are perpendicular to the beam which describe a circular arc of radius 0.1 m. Specific charge of electron is
explanation_plain_text:
Again,

Then,
ans1_plain_text: 1.8 10 C/kg
ans2_plain_text: 1.7 10 C/kg
ans3_plain_text: 1.8 10 C/kg
ans4_plain_text: 1.8 10 C/kg

quest_title: A counter give 82 counts/sec After 210 seconds the count rate become 19 counts/s. The background count is 10 counts/sec then half life of source is
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{\mathrm{C}-10}{\mathrm{C}_{0}-10}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1/2}}}\)
or, \(\cfrac{19-10}{82-10}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1/2}}} \)
or, \(\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{3}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1/2}}}\)
or, \(T_{1/2} = \cfrac{210}{3} = 70\, \text{sec}\)

quest_title: To form a composite 16 \(\mu\)F, 1000 V capacitor from a supply of identical capacitors marked 8 \(\mu\)F, 250 V, we require a minimum number of \(\text{n}\) capacitors where \(\text{n}\) is
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{1}{2} \mathrm{CV}^{2}=\mathrm{n} \cfrac{1}{2}\left(\mathrm{C}^{\prime} \mathrm{V}^{\prime 2}\right)\)

or, \(\mathrm{n}=\cfrac{\mathrm{C}}{\mathrm{C}^{\prime}} \times\left(\cfrac{\mathrm{V}}{\mathrm{V}^{\prime}}\right)^{2}\)

\(\qquad=\cfrac{16}{8} \times\left(\cfrac{1000}{250}\right)^{2}=32\)

quest_title: The resistance between the terminal points A and B of the given infinitely long circuit will be
explanation_txt:
Let \(R_{A B}=x\)

\( \text { So, } R_{x y} =x \text { (also) } \)

\( R_{A B}= 1+\cfrac{x}{x+1}+1 \)

\( \text { Or, } x=2+\cfrac{x}{x+1} \)

\( \text { Or, } x^{2}+x=2 x+2+x \)

\( \text { Or, } x^{2}-2 x-2=0 \)

\( \text { Or, } x=\cfrac{-(-2) \pm \sqrt{(-2)^{2}-4 \times 1 \times(-2)}}{2 \times 1} \)

\( \text { Or, } x=+1 \pm \sqrt{3} \)

Taking +ve sign:

\(x = +(1-\sqrt 3)\)

But this cannot be resistance because resistance is not –ve.

Taking -ve sign:

\(x=(1+\sqrt 3)\)

quest_title: If for a thermocouple \(T_{n} \) is the neutral temperature, \(T_{c} \) is the temperature of the cold junction and \(T_{i} \) is the temperature of inversion, then
explanation_txt:
Neutral temperature \(T_{n}\) is the the temperature difference at which thermo e.m.f becomes maximum and is equal to the average of temperature of cold junction \(T_{c}\) and temperature of inversion \(T_{i}\).

\(T_{n} =\cfrac{T_{i} +T_{C} }{2} \, \Rightarrow \)\(T_{i} =2T_{n} -T_{C} \)
question_plain_title: If for a thermocouple is the neutral temperature, is the temperature of the cold junction and is the temperature of inversion, then
explanation_plain_text: Neutral temperature is the the temperature difference at which thermo e.m.f becomes maximum and is equal to the average of temperature of cold junction and temperature of inversion .

quest_title: A proton is moving along \(\textit{Z}\)-axis in a magnetic field. The magnetic field is along \(\textit{X-}\)axis. The proton will experience a force along
explanation_txt:
\(\overrightarrow{F} =q(\overrightarrow{v} \times \overrightarrow{B} )\)

Applying right hand rule of cross product, \(\overrightarrow{F} =q\left((v\overrightarrow{k}) \times (B\overrightarrow{j}) \right)=Bvq\left(\vec{k}\times\vec{i}\right)=Bvq \, \, \vec{j}\) (i.e. Along Y axis)
question_plain_title: A proton is moving along -axis in a magnetic field. The magnetic field is along axis. The proton will experience a force along
explanation_plain_text: Applying right hand rule of cross product, (i.e. Along Y axis)

quest_title: A characteristic feature of reversible reaction is that
ans3_txt: they are not complete unless the products are removed from the reaction system
explanation_txt: In a reversible reaction, the reactants are in dynamic equilibrium. This means the forward and backward reactions proceed at equal rate and hence the reaction is never completed.
question_plain_title: A characteristic feature of reversible reaction is that
explanation_plain_text: In a reversible reaction, the reactants are in dynamic equilibrium. This means the forward and backward reactions proceed at equal rate and hence the reaction is never completed.

quest_title: The total number of all possible subsets of a given set A containing n elements is:
explanation_txt:
Consider a set:

\(A=\{a_1,a_2,a_3,...\}\)

To construct a subset, we may select zero element, one element, two elements and so on upto \(n=n(A)\) elements.

So, the total number is:

\({}^nC_0+{}^nC_1+{}^nC_2+\dots+{}^nC_n=2^n\)

quest_title: If two sides of a triangle are represented by \(x ^ { 2 } - 7 x y + 6 y ^ { 2 } = 0\) and the centroid is (1, 0) then the equation of third side is
explanation_txt:
Given two lines are \(x - 6 y = 0\) and \(x - y = 0\).

We know \(\cfrac { 0 + x _ { 1 } + x _ { 2 } } { 3 } = 1\)

\(\Rightarrow x _ { 1 } + x _ { 2 } = 3\) .....(i)

and \(y _ { 1 } + y _ { 2 } = 0\) .....(ii)

Also \(x _ { 1 } - 6 y _ { 1 } = 0\) .....(iii)

\(x _ { 2 } - y _ { 2 } = 0\) .....(iv)

[Since the point (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) lies on the lines AB and AC respectively]

Now on solving, the coordinates of B and C are \(\left( \cfrac { 18 } { 5 } , \cfrac { 3 } { 5 } \right)\) and \(\left( \cfrac { - 3 } { 5 } , \cfrac { - 3 } { 5 } \right)\) respectively.

Hence the equation of third side i.e., BC is \(2 x - 7 y - 3 = 0\) .

quest_title: The locus of the middle points of those chords of the circle \(x ^ { 2 } + y ^ { 2 } = 4\) which subtend a right angle at the origin is
explanation_txt:
Let the mid-point of chord is (h, k). Also radius of circle is 2.

Therefore, \(\cfrac { O C } { O B } = \cos 45 ^ { \circ } \Rightarrow \cfrac { \sqrt { h ^ { 2 } + k ^ { 2 } } } { 2 } = \cfrac { 1 } { \sqrt { 2 } } \Rightarrow h ^ { 2 } + k ^ { 2 } = 2\)

Hence locus is \(x ^ { 2 } + y ^ { 2 } = 2\)

quest_title: The formation of the oxide ion \(O_{(g)}^{2-} \) requires first an exothermic and then an endothermic step as shown below \[O_{(g)} +e^{-} =O_{(g)}^{-} \Delta H^{0} =-142\; kJmol^{-1} \] \[O_{(g)}^{-} +e^{-} =O_{(g)}^{2-} \Delta H^{0} =844\; kJmol^{-1} \] This is because
ans1_txt: \(O^{-} \) ion will tend to resist the addition of another electron
ans4_txt: \(O^{-} \) ion has comparatively larger size than oxygen atom
explanation_txt: The addition of second electron in an atom or ion is always endothermic.
